page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content:
A BUS COMES THROUGH THE VILLAGE TWICE A DAY, ONCE IN THE MORNING AND ONCE IN THE AFTERNOON, EXCEPT ON SUNDAY WHEN THERE ARE NO BUSES. MOST PEOPLE USE PRIVATE CARS BECAUSE THERE ARE SO FEW BUSES. THE NEAREST RAILWAY STATION IS AT BERWICK, ABOUT TEN MILES AWAY.
ALTHOUGH THE VILLAGE HAS ONLY ONE SHOP, IT HAS SOME VANS CALLING. THE MILKMAN DELIVERS ON MONDAY, WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY. THE BUTCHER COMES ON TUESDAY AND FRIDAY AND THE FISH VAN COMES ON A FRIDAY AS WELL. THE LIBRARY COMES EVERY SECOND WEDNESDAY. THE DUSTBINS ARE EMPTIED EVERY WEDNESDAY. TWO COALMEN COME ALTERNATE MONDAYS AND WEDNESDAYS AND SOMETIMES A WINDOW CLEANER.
